questions.question: The Timer2 module in PIC18F4550 supports which of the following modes?
Which register is used to configure the Timer2 prescaler value in PIC18F4550?
What is the maximum value that can be loaded into the PR2 register for Timer2 in PIC18F4550?
Which pin(s) on the PIC18F4550 can be used to generate the PWM signal?
Which Timer2 mode allows for the generation of a PWM signal in PIC18F4550?
In PWM, the duty cycle represents:

answers.a: The time period of the PWM signal
answers.b: The voltage level applied to the LED
answers.c: The ratio of ON time to the total time period of the PWM signal
answers.d: The frequency of the PWM signal

questions.question: What is the benefit of using PWM for LED brightness control compared to directly varying the voltage applied to the LED?

answers.d: PWM eliminates the need for a microcontroller

questions.question: Can the brightness of an LED be controlled using PWM on any microcontroller?

answers.b: No, only specific microcontrollers have built-in PWM capability.
answers.d: It depends on the LED's specifications.

questions.question: How can the duty cycle of a PWM signal be adjusted to control the LED brightness?

answers.a: By changing the frequency of the PWM signal
answers.b: By adjusting the voltage applied to the microcontroller

questions.question: What are the advantages of using a microcontroller-based approach for PWM LED brightness control?

answers.c: Ability to integrate with other sensors or systems
